Blocks

Lightweight javascript tooling to organize, communicate, and deliver modular design systems and living style guides.

Download Kit View On Github @8sblocks

Independent Tools for Modular Designs

Include

Dynamically inject a component's HTML and its associated CSS and JS in page layouts with advanced controls using only a browser*. No server needed.

*except older IE, yawn.

Example Code Tutorial & Doc
  • /includes/sign-in.html
  • /includes/sign-in.css
  • /includes/sign-in.js
Injected in this page! 
<div data-esb-include="sign-in-form"></div>

Mark

Mark components in layouts with names and/or IDs.

Use To

  • Illustrate page composition
  • Demonstrate component use
  • Link to documentation
Example Code Tutorial & Doc 
<form action="#" class="esb-sign-in-form" data-esb-mark="G24 Sign In">
	<div class="form-group">
		<label for="username">Username</label>
		<input type="text" id="username" name="username">
	</div>
	<div class="form-group">
		<label for="password">Password</label>
		<input type="password" id="password" name="password">
	</div>
	<button type="submit" class="btn">Go</button>
</form>

Frame

Frame components in a responsive context.

Use To

  • Show and compare variations & states
  • Compare as small multiples
  • Demonstrate responsiveness across widths
  • Present in gallery or list formats
Example Code Tutorial & Doc 
<div data-esb-frame="sign-in-form" 
     data-esb-variation="default" 
     data-esb-title="G24 Sign In" 
     data-esb-scale="0.5"></div>

Page Frame

Frame a scaled page layout in a predictable responsive context.

Use To

  • Embed in documentation, avoiding screenshots
  • Display adjacent to notes or specs
  • Compare as small multiples or in device frames
  • Present in gallery or list formats
Example Code Tutorial & Doc 
<div data-esb-frame="site/sign-in-page.html" 
     data-esb-title="Sign In Page" 
     data-esb-height="200"></div>

Use Blocks with Any Design Library…

At EightShapes, we typically build libraries from scratch. But EightShapes Blocks is built to be incorporated into HTML/CSS libraries of any form.

To help you understand how Blocks works, we've incorporated it into two very popular frameworks.

Bootstrap

See Example

Foundation

See Example

…to Build Your Own Living Style Guide

About EightShapes Blocks

EightShapes created Blocks to ease the process of prototyping in HTML & CSS and delivering responsive web designs to our clients starting in 2011. While mainly used as a tool for our team, we shared and spoke about the first version with the design community.

Since then, we rewrote a v2 and expanded Blocks to include other tooling to flexibly deliver modular design systems to our clients and stand up living style guides on their behalf.

We welcome your feedback and input on how to improve the system. You can reach out to us @8sblocks.
